intro: Lobelia tenella, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and arranged alternately along the stem. Lobelia tenella thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland settings.
